headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Trump Vows to Left RFK Jr. Go Wild; Neil deGrasse Tyson is Interviewed about his New Book; Rep. Brendan Boyle (D-PA) is Interviewed about Pennsylvania Voters; Haley Comments on Trump Campaign. Aired 6:30-7a ET

utterances.speaker: KASIE HUNT, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: So, you did say it. Do you still believe it?ROBERT F. KENNEDY JR.: Well I - here's what - here's what I - here's what I would say. First of all, I'm not anti-vaccine.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: How is that statement not anti-vaccine?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: Well, it's - I - it's - I can say right now there's no vaccine - medicine for cancer that's safe and effective. It doesn't (INAUDIBLE) all medicines.I've been fighting for years to get mercury out of fish. Nobody calls me anti-fish. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KAREN FINNEY, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Well, now that you got a whale head on the top of your car, we might. OK.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Kristen, I mean, do - I - does this help Trump?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Proceeded. And there it is, Houston, there's Camelot.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Look at that target.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I see it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We've got them all.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: As I step off at the surface at Taurus-Littrow, I'd like to dedicate these first steps of Apollo 17 to all those who made it possible.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: That right there was the last time NASA astronaut stepped foot on the moon. It was back in 1972. It was a feat that many Americans saw, of course, as the apex of human discovery. But 52 years later, we still haven't been back, even as one of America's wealthiest men - men has become fixated - look at that. That was his rocket getting caught recently. He's become fixated on colonizing Mars.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) DONALD TRUMP (R), FORMER U.S. PRESIDENT AND 2024 PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE: Elon Musk has been campaigning every single day in Pennsylvania. (INAUDIBLE). You know, when that rocket landed last week, I saw that rocket land. I said, this guy, that's his. I got to call him. I said, was that yours? He said, that was mine. That sucker came back down, just coming in, and it's - it's going to crash. I'm saying, oh, no. It's going right next to the gantry (ph). It's coming down at an angle. I don't like that. It's not good. But what the hell do I know. It's up to Elon, not me, but it's coming. And then all of a sudden you see the fire and the jets going. The bottom are - just fires ripping the shh - ripping in the - then it came in - those beautiful arms came in and they hugged it like you would hug your little beautiful baby. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: OK.Joining us now to discuss is astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson. He is the author of the new book, "Merlin's Tour of the Universe: A Traveler's Guide to Blue Moons, Black Holes, Mars, Stars and Everything Far." Sir, I am so grateful to have you on the program. NEIL DEGRASSE TYSON, AUTHOR OF "MERLIN'S TOUR OF THE UNIVERSE": Thanks for having me on.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Thank you for being here.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Honestly, it's a welcome - I would say it's a respite from the campaign trail, but I guess it's not actually because -

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Well, yes, space is everywhere. Space is everywhere, so you can't - but, yes, there are - there are connected points (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, this is a - this is - this one was your first book and you've updated it.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Well, yes. Yes. My first - very first. I wrote it in graduate school, actually. And it was - turned out to be the proving ground of all the different ways, even to this day, that I communicate science to the public. Little quirky, fun - Merlin is a fictional character that I created to be this tutor of the universe. And merlin's been around - it's not the - it's not the Arthurian Merlin.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Like there's more than one Joe in the world. There's more than one Merlin.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: More than one Merlin. That's fair.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: But Merlin is from another galaxy visiting earth and has known everybody. So, people have asked questions. I don't quite understand how gravity works and so Merlin would recall a conversation with Isaac Newton.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: OK. TYSON

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Yes, they're so cute.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: And so it's just - it's just a - it's a -

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: So, can I ask, how would Merlin explain Elon Musk and his view of colonizing Mars.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Oh, so Merlin is wise, OK.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Uh-huh.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Right. Well, that's some of what's going on now.So, I have another set of sound from Donald Trump and Elon Musk. I don't think they're directly in the forms of questions, but I think Merlin could take them as such.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Let's watch.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) DONALD TRUMP (R), FORMER U.S. PRESIDENT AND 2024 PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE: There's no reason not to. I mean there's no reason not to think that Mars and all these planets don't have life.

utterances.speaker: ELON MUSK,
utterances.sentences: Maybe the aliens will come visit us. Maybe - maybe they are here right now.I haven't seen any like sort of green aliens with antennas on their head or anything like that. And maybe there are, they're just very subtle. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: So, are aliens here?

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Quickly. Quickly. Aliens with antennas. The only people who imagined them that way are those who remember the antennas on TV sets, the rabbit - remember? Back when that was how you communicated through space. Our aliens that we drew had antennas. So, that's an old- fashioned way to think about aliens.He - Elon is wondering whether they've already visited us. I'm pretty sure had - had they visited us that they ran home concluding that there's no sign of intelligent life on Earth.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Awe. Well, that's underselling you, sir.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: No. And so one other question I have for you because, obviously, everyone is wondering, certainly a lot of viewers of this program and others, who's going to win the election. And "The Economist," OK, so a serious publication, "The Economist," wonders what astro - astrology - astrologers, is that how you say it, astrologers - astrologers are predicting the result of American's election. So, quote, "Donald Trump's horoscope illuminates the laptop screen. He's going to enter the peak of his life in April 2025, Helena Woods, a professional astrologer, tells your correspondent, a Pisces. As for Kamala Harris, Jupiter and Saturn are aligning in her favor. If she does win, I do think she might carry out two terms, said Ms. Woods."Is there anything to this?

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Yes, if astrologers had power, as much power as they want, we would still be living in caves.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: I'm just - no, think of the ego involved in suggesting that the universe cares about us on a level where the planets are trying to fix outcomes of your lives, of your love life, of your financial life, of your political engagements. That means you think you're in the center of the universe. And these people have not seen how big the universe is and how small we are to make such claims.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: So, you don't read horoscopes?

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Oh, is that - did I make that clear.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: I didn't know.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Very clear.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Well, there's a whole - there's a whole - there's a whole section of the Merlin book where we - Merlin addresses this topic.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: All right, that's - it's why I asked. I thought -

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Because there's 13 constellations, not 12, in the zodiac, by the way.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: That's also a fair point.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: So, look, I have one serious question for you.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: And it goes to what we had heard from RFK Jr. there. Do - are you concerned about the way Americans are willing to believe or not believe science in the day and age?

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Especially in the wake of Covid?

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: It would be the - the extent to which science is either denied or rejected or ignored will be the unraveling of an informed democracy at a time when - when so much of who and what we are, our health, our wealth, and our security pivots on the advances in science that surround us. To the extent that that's ignored or rejected, we just give up. Just forget our leadership in the world and let's just watch the rest of the world take over because they embrace science in ways that scares me here what - the way I see people talking about it and reacting to it.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: All right, well, it's a fascinating book. Fascinating to have you on the show.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: Well, thank you. Thanks for having me.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Come back anytime. I really appreciate it, Neil.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: And maybe next time I'll have a - like a real mug instead of a plastic mug here.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: We'll get you - we'll get you a mug. I'm sorry about the paper cup.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: You know.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Yes, I know. Hopefully we'll actually have CNN THIS MORNING mugs. I think I told you in the break, I'm the indecisive one, which is why we don't have them yet.

utterances.speaker: TYSON
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: All right, don't forget this new book is "Merlin's Story of the Universe(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: SEAN HANNITY, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: You wish he wasn't there?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, I don't know if it's a big deal or not, but I don't want anybody making nasty jokes or stupid jokes. And probably he shouldn't have been there, yes.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Most campaigns actually, in the final days, at least the ones that I've covered, do actually vet the speakers that they put out before their candidates, but, hey.Joining us now, Democratic Congressman Brendan Boyle of Pennsylvania. Congressman, wonderful to have you on the show. Thanks for being here. REP. BRENDAN BOYLE (D-PA): Yes, thanks for having me, Kasie.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: So, let's start with how this remark and, you know, you saw Trump sort of - not really - I mean you characterize what you think that was from him, and apology, not an apology. There's clearly some acknowledgement from the campaign that this is a problem. They had people speaking Spanish up on the stage at the rally in Allentown. The campaign did distance itself from this comment.What impact are you seeing with Latino voters on the ground in Pennsylvania?

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, I happen to represent more than 100,000 Puerto Ricans, people who were either born on the island or come from families that hail from there. One of the really largest Puerto Rican populations anywhere in the United States. And so I was talking, as you can imagine, to a lot of folks from that community in the last 24 hours. And what they tell me is they're struck by the fact that this has broken through. That in a time in which a lot of people tune out politics, not much breaks through the noise. This really has, and has spread like wildfire, as Stephen Colbert said in his late night monologue last night.So, look, I know there's a school of thought when it comes to Donald Trump after the last ten years that ultimately none of this has any sort of effect. I don't think that's actually true though. I mean we saw that in 2020. He was the first president since George Herbert Walker Bush to lose re-election. And I do think that this comment, especially coming as late as it does, is having somewhat of an effect with the half a million or so Puerto Ricans who live in Pennsylvania.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Congressman, of course, the other person who used the word garbage in a recent interview is President Biden, who had made a comment saying that Trump supporters were garbage.

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: Exactly. HUNT

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, let's not do the false equivalency thing. I actually read the transcript. It's pretty clear in the same setting he said this -

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: I'm not trying to do false equivalency, sir. I'm just asking six days out from the campaign if this is helpful.

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: He said - excuse me, he - he referred - he - he referred to the speaker, meaning the person who was the comedian who said this. Donald Trump - everyone knows who Donald Trump is. Is anyone really surprised by that festival of hate that he had at Madison Square Garden.And frankly, it wasn't just the one mean-spirited, vicious joke of a comedian that he decided to platform. There were many other speakers as well at Madison Square Garden at his final closing argument. Compare that to Kamala Harris, who in her closing argument last night said that to her political opponents she's not going to threaten to jail them as Donald Trump has. She's going to give them a seat at the table. That's probably why so many Republicans, especially in the suburbs of Philadelphia, are actually supporting Kamala Harris in this campaign.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Sir, briefly, there's been some back-and-forth in the press and kind of in these final days. There's a super PAC that pays for a lot of Kamala Harris' ads. They've been focused on an economic based message. The campaign has had a slightly different closing message.What do you think is most productive for Pennsylvania voters to hear here in the final days? Is - do you think it's helpful for Harris to continue to call Trump a fascist, or do you want to see more economic messaging?

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: And do you think it's moving votes?

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: I will say, however, when I'm out campaigning, as I will be later here today in Philadelphia, I always point out to people that Donald Trump is exactly who he tells us he is. He is a billionaires who only cares about billionaires like himself. His tax agenda when he was in office was to provide a massive $2 trillion tax cuts to billionaires. In every single one of Trump's budget over four years, cut Social Security, Medicare, and Medicaid. That is the message that I tend to lean on the most here in Philadelphia.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: All right, Congressman Brendan Boyle, very grateful to have you on the show. I hope you'll come back soon. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right, thank you.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: All right, turning now to this. Former Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley raising alarm over some of the Trump campaign's recent rhetoric. She's warning that they could be scaring away women voters.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) NIKKI HALEY (R), FORMER PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE: This is not a time to have anyone criticized Puerto Rico or Latinos. This is not a time for them to get overly masculine with this bromance thing that they've got going. Fifty-three percent of the electorate are women. Women will vote. They care about how they're being talked to, and they care about the issues. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Some of these, the so-called bromance, is possibly on display during Trump's recent appearances on a number of podcasts.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) DONALD TRUMP (R), FORMER U.S. PRESIDENT AND 2024 PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE: There's no reason not to think that Mars and all these planets don't have life. Is cocaine a stronger -

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Up?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: A lot of wrestlers want to be - they'd want to do the UFC thing. But they can't take the shots.I played football too. I didn't particularly like it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What position were you.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't like it. I played tight -- tight end.I'll tell you about TikTok. Trump is going to keep TikTok going. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: All right, our panel's back.Kristen Soltis Anderson, is Nikki Haley correct? ANDERSON: Well, I don't think it's bad for Republicans to do outreach to young men who feel like both political parties have failed them over the last couple of decades. I don't think that's a bad strategy. I do think, if it's all you're doing, if you're not making overtures to women, I do think that that's a problem considering that women are the majority of voters in this country. But it wouldn't surprise me, frankly, if we don't see a huge gender divide in this election. In today's "New York Times," a great column by Democratic pollster Celinda Lake, Republican pollster Amanda Iovino. I adore both of them. And they've written about how this election is going to be the one where the gender divide is huge. Trump is gambling that he can run up the numbers more with men than Harris will with women. I think that's a dangerous gamble, but I don't think it's wrong for Trump to go after disaffected young men who feel like the two political parties have failed them.

utterances.speaker: ALEX THOMPSON, CNN POLITICAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: But to your point, he's not making a huge effort to go after women. That Madison Square Garden speech, there were 31 speakers, 25 of them were men. And I know because I was there for all eight hours. And Nikki Haley could be out there on the trail for Donald Trump if Donald Trump could get over his own bitterness and ego and actually give her a call. She's made very clear, she'll do it, but you have to call me first.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: THOMPSON
utterances.sentences: And if - and if he loses, like he might regret not making that call.

utterances.speaker: MARK PRESTON, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: You know, I think that, I do agree, if he does lose, it will be because of the margin of women that he lost in these key battleground states, whether it be Wisconsin or Pennsylvania.

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: Women and probably young women, I think, in particular who are, again, turning out in huge numbers, both in voter registration and in early vote. And, I mean, I agree, talking to young men, absolutely an important thing to do. It's how you do it. You don't have to do it at the at expense of crapping on women and constantly talking down to women and constantly having -

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Can I -

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: I want to show a part from the rally that Haley was talking about and then you can continue.

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Let's watch this.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TUCKER CARLSON, FORMER FOX NEWS ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: She's just so impressive. As the first Samoan, Malaysian, low IQ, former California prosecutor ever to be elected president.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: She's a pretender. Her and her pimp handlers will destroy our country.

utterances.speaker: HULK HOGAN
utterances.sentences: When I hear Kamala speak, it sounds - yes, it sounds like a script from Hollywood with a really, really bad actress.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Kamala Harris is a c-word. You heard that right, a big ole c-word.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: Yes. Nice.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Difference between bromancing with the podcasters, dancing, which I take your point on and all of that.

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: Exactly. And that - and actually that's pretty tame for Tucker because remember last time he talked about daddy coming home and spanking his daughter. So, yes. So, that happened too. And I learned about it on your show, Kasie.But, I mean - so, I mean, I think that's the problem -

utterances.speaker: PRESTON
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: THOMPSON
utterances.sentences: I was just going to ask, is this more overt than what you faced in '16 with Hillary?

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: No, because Trump's - and the hatred against Hillary is - was so visceral and 30 years baked in. But it's - it's more. It's - it's not more gendered, but it's more racist for sure.
